Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: விடுமாற்றம் வேந்தர்க்கு உரைப்பான் வடுமாற்றம் வாய்சோரா வன்க ணவன்
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: He alone is fit to communicate (his sovereign's) reply, who possesses the firmness not to utter even inadvertently what may reflect discredit (on the latter).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: An envoy is delivering a critical final message or reply ('விடுமாற்றம்') to a foreign king.
Layered_Composition.Midground: His mind is depicted as a fortress of resolve ('வன்கணவன்'). Shadowy, tempting words of disgrace or error ('வடுமாற்றம்') are trying to slip out of his mouth, but the fortress of his mind has a powerful gate that is firmly locked, preventing any slip of the tongue ('வாய்சோரா').
Layered_Composition.Background: A tense court scene where a single wrong word could lead to disaster. The envoy's self-control is the only thing maintaining peace.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The envoy fit to deliver the final word is one with the mental fortitude to never let a disgraceful or erroneous word slip from his mouth.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The mind as a locked fortress is the central metaphor for mental toughness. The shadowy, disgraceful words are the temptations he must control.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Controlled, disciplined, firm, mentally tough, reliable.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A tense, dramatic lighting. The envoy's face is a mask of concentration. The shadowy words trying to escape his mouth have a sinister, smoky quality.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A tight close-up on the envoy's face, with a surreal overlay showing the fortress of his mind in action.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, cinematic, with a focus on the intense expression.

Negative_Prompt: envoy misspeaking, weak-minded envoy, text artifacts, cartoonish.

Hyperparameters.seed: Explore variations for the 'fortress of the mind'.
